final_poem:
The sky unspools its silver threads,  
a whisper stitching clouds to earth.  
Each drop a secret, cold and bright,  
it hums the hymn of roots and wings.  
The pavement drinks the trembling light,  
a mirror cracked with borrowed grace.  
The trees, half-drowned in their own shade,  
hold breath like leaves in a forgotten vase.  
And when the storm has kissed the ground,  
the air is heavy with the scent  
of wet stone and the ache of dawn—  
a world reborn in every drop.
